intro: Aneilema ecuadoriense, commonly known as the Ecuadorian aneilema, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant features arrow-shaped leaves and produces inflorescences with spadices and berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest for horticulturists and botanists.
